City of Gresham, Oregon has franchises with private Trash Haulers.  The haulers are regulated by the city and pay a franchise fee for the exclusive right to an area of the city.

answers.author: Christopher Raths
answers.text:
Ms. Kent,
Our Township of 25,000 in New Jersey was in a similar sitution and recently went to an outside vendor. We provided the 16 member division an opportunity to meet the private haulers price. They were unable to do so when legacy cost were included. The Townhsip provides healt insurance for retirees. Depending on the actuary formula the cost of this benefit ranged from 4.5 million to 8.9 million. 
I have several reports I could provide if needed.
Chris Raths
Roxbury Township Manager

author: Catherine Kent
text:
Our city is one of the only ones in southeast Michigan where city crews perform trash collection services for residential areas.  Due to budget and millage constraints, Ann Arbor is considering privatizing trash collection services.  Can you provide examples of cities that have privatized in the last 5 years or so by signing a contract with a single service provider? 
We are investigating: 
- Estimated financial savings 
- Contract stipulations to manage customer service
- What happens to city assets 
Please provide city names, information, or contacts. Thanks!
title: Example cities that have privatized trash pickup?
